words.clue: A journey electrons can only take if the path is unbroken
The electrical “pressure” behind every pushy charge
The opposition to the flow of electric current
The rate at which electrical energy is used or produced
Tiny traveller; moves opposite the direction of conventional current
The unit that sounds like it could give you a “shock” of potential
Unit of resistance that looks like it’s saying “Oh…” when written
Unit of power that rhymes with “hot”
Component of a circuit that decreases the current
It can break open a circuit with just a flick
A device that turns electricity into light, sound, or movement
A property of most metals that allows electrons to move easily
A circuit where everything waits its turn in one line
A circuit layout that lets electricity take multiple “routes”
A dangerous mistake: the path of least resistance.
